alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Early; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 5:10PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dale, Henry, Coffee and northwestern Geneva Counties in southeastern Alabama, Clay, southwestern Randolph, southwestern Calhoun and northwestern Early Counties in southwestern Georgia through 600 PM EDT/500 PM CDT/... At 510 PM EDT/410 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fort Novosel to 6 miles southeast of Abbeville to near Fort Gaines. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Daleville, Elba, Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Blakely, Fort Novosel, Enterprise, Headland, Ozark, Midland City, Level Plains, Edison, Newton, Arlington, New Brockton, Ariton, Pinckard, Kinsey, Lee and Clayhatchee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
